org.agilewiki.utils.dsm

Class DiskSpaceManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.agilewiki.utils.dsm.DiskSpaceManager

  • public class DiskSpaceManager
extends java.lang.Object
    A durable class for managing up to a million blocks. And if each block is 1 MB in length, DSM can then manage a 1TB file.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DiskSpaceManager()
      Create a DSM with no space allocated.
      DiskSpaceManager(java.nio.ByteBuffer byteBuffer)
      Read a bit array from a ByteBuffer.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int allocate()
      Allocates a block of disk space.
      void commit()
      Make the blocks available which had been released.
      int durableLength()
      Returns the number of bytes needed to save the allocation data, plus 4 for the length.
      void release(int i)
      Release a block.
      int usage()
      Returns the number of allocated pages.
      void write(java.nio.ByteBuffer byteBuffer)
      Write the bit array to a ByteBuffer.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • DiskSpaceManager

        public DiskSpaceManager()
        Create a DSM with no space allocated.

      • DiskSpaceManager

        public DiskSpaceManager(java.nio.ByteBuffer byteBuffer)
        Read a bit array from a ByteBuffer. The bit array indicates which blocks are in use. The ByteBuffer contains first a byte count pf the size of the bit array, followed by the bytes of the bit array.
        Parameters:
        byteBuffer - The source of the bit array.

    • Method Detail

      • allocate

        public int allocate()
        Allocates a block of disk space.
        Returns:
        The number of the block that was allocated.

      • usage

        public int usage()
        Returns the number of allocated pages.
        Returns:
        The number of pages in use.

      • release

        public void release(int i)
        Release a block. It will become available on the next transaction.
        Parameters:
        i - The block to be released.

      • durableLength

        public int durableLength()
        Returns the number of bytes needed to save the allocation data, plus 4 for the length.
        Returns:
        The number of bytes needed to save the bit array.

      • commit

        public void commit()
        Make the blocks available which had been released.

        Calling commit will sometimes reduce the durable length. So commit should be called before durableLength if an accurate result is needed for a subsequent write.

      • write

        public void write(java.nio.ByteBuffer byteBuffer)
        Write the bit array to a ByteBuffer.
        Parameters:
        byteBuffer - Holds the bit array.
